meanings.definition: The set of all possible values that a function can output.
meanings.sent1: In math class, we learned that the codomain is the range of possible answers.
meanings.sent2: The codomain of the function includes all the potential output values.
meanings.sent3: The codomain decided to throw a party for all the possible answers.
meanings.sent4: Her imagination was the codomain of endless creativity.
meanings.sent5: The codomain stretched as far as the eye could see, full of answers waiting to be discovered.

meanings.definition: The set of all possible values that a relation can output.
meanings.sent1: When studying relations, it's important to understand the concept of codomain.
meanings.sent2: The codomain of the relation encompasses all the potential output values.
meanings.sent3: The codomain and the domain went on a date to explore their possibilities.
meanings.sent4: His heart was the codomain of her affections, holding all the love she had to give.
meanings.sent5: The codomain was a treasure trove of outcomes, waiting to be uncovered through analysis.
